Description: In 2020, I launched Keskusteluohjelma—a conversation series built on one idea: we need to talk more like only humans can. So far almost 100 guests, from politicians to punks to scientists and beyond. Runs as a YouTube series and a podcast.

A construction-specific software company with a 90s vibe needed a dust off. We kept their no-nonsense professionalism and rebuilt the brand around clarity and experience. I sourced the right team, worked with the client to set direction, and helped them modernise around the valuable core.
I was the outsider on the team when Finland’s main church took its first significant step into social media, launching on Facebook in the early 2010s.

R-Collection is a renowned Finnish clothing brand celebrated for its comfortable basics and iconic anoraks. With a dedicated team, both in-house and external, we revitalized this timeless classic to its deserved prominence.
For Flow Festival, I scripted and hosted FlowTV—short conversations with artists, musicians, and thinkers backstage. The idea was to keep it bare: no makeup, no setups, no planned answers.

A fossil-free motor oil needed a name and an entry point. I offered Lubrican—as in: “others can’t.” I shaped the concept and brought in an art director who understood the tone: bold, slightly off, and grounded in the industry. Legacybuilding.

As a gun-for-hire journalist, I’ve worked with Helsinki Uni’s comms team to bring complex research to life—subjects like neuroscience, cancer, and mathematics. Given a theme, I’ve gone in with a film crew to figure out what’s really there.
I had a hand in shaping the tone as Strawberry brought their newest central hot-spot hotel to life in Helsinki.

Kaarlen maailma aired on YLE TV2 for 36 episodes. I wrote and hosted the show—one guest at a time, one question at a time. We talked about politics, philosophy, the internet, death, and love. The format was prime time TV, tone wasn’t.
7th Day' was a talk and music radio show airing on Sunday mornings, featuring a special selection of music to ease into the day.
Kaikkea saa kysyä (AMA) laid the groundwork for many of my later interview projects. 40 episodes of unhurried, prime-time radio on Radio Helsinki.

Secto brought their fossil-free racing to bigger stages in Finland, Japan, and beyond. I helped shape the voice and sourced an Art Director immersed in the world of Japanese tuning shops—the exact aesthetic the client lived and breathed.

Fifteen years ago, I did the original brand visuals for Secto—back when it was three guys in a basement. Now they’re a company with hundreds of employees and hundreds of millions in revenue. When it was time for a redesign, they called me again. I helped clarify the task and brought in the right art director to carry it through.

We told the client we wouldn’t take the job unless they agreed on one thing: we’re not advertising to kids. We were a three-person wildcard team, pitching against the usual agency suspects—and we won. Porn-site banners. Fake film posters. Nuclear energy jokes. A sweating bottle with a towel. A green variation wearing a competitor’s cap. The campaign sold energy drinks while making fun of how energy drinks are sold.
Worked closely with Kesko’s top leadership on strategy and positioning. Full case available for relevant prospects.
